thread.title: Aust bonds higher as CBA hikes
thread.title_full: Aust bonds higher as CBA hikes

title: Aust bonds higher as CBA hikes
text:
Thu, Oct 22, 2015, 8:56 PM NZDT - New Zealand Markets closed Aust bonds higher as CBA hikes AAP â€“ 1 hour 4 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The Australian bond market has firmed after the Commonwealth Bank followed Westpac and increased its variable interest rate. 
Commonwealth Bank, the country's largest bank, is lifting its standard variable interest rate on home loans by 0.15 percentage points to 5.6 per cent. 
This comes after Westpac announced last week that it will hike its standard variable rate by 0.2 percentage points. 
RBC Capital Markets fixed income and currency strategist Michael Turner said the other two major banks, ANZ and National Australia Bank, would likely follow suit, adding more pressure on the Reserve Bank to cut its cash rate. 
"This decision from the CBA late in the afternoon may increase the odds of an RBA rate cut," Mr Turner said. 
"This has been enough to unwind some of the weakness in the bond market earlier in the session." 
At 1630 AEDT on Thursday, the December 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 97.345 (implying a yield of 2.655 per cent), up from 97.315 (2.685 per cent) on Wednesday. 
The December 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.190 (1.810 per cent), up from 98.170 (1.830 per cent). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.807 pct, from 1.830pct on Wednesday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.699 pct, from 2.731pct 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* December 2015 bill futures, 97.950, from 97.940 
* March 2015 bill futures, 98.090, from 98.070 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEDT previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
